title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the user needs to save their changes. The problem is that the user has to figure out how to save the changes or discard them, which is even harder. The error message displayed is not very helpful as it simply states "Source page is dirty." Additionally, a dialog titled "Error" is shown.
OB: After editing XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, when attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating that the source page is dirty.
EB: Upon editing XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, when attempting to switch back to the Layout view, the user should be presented with clear options to either save or discard the changes made. The error message should provide more detailed information about the nature of the issue instead of simply stating that the source page is dirty.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the "source" view.
3. Make changes to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message about the dirty source page and the lack of clear options to save or discard the changes.
